| pop = 'Mexican Americans' '33,558,000'  

| regions = Southwest, West Coast, Upper Midwest. There are also emerging
| populations in the South and Northeast. languages = Spanish, American English,
| Spanglish, and a minority of Indigenous Mexican languages. religions =
| Predominantly Roman Catholic; minority of Protestants. image2 =

'Mexican Americans' (Spanish: 'Mexicano estadounidense') are Americans of full
or partial Mexican descent. As of July 2011, Mexican Americans make up 10.8% of
the United States' population with over 33,558,000 Americans listed as being of
full or partial Mexican ancestry. As of 2011, Mexican Americans comprise 64.6%
of all Hispanics and Latinos in the United States. [http://factfinder2.census.gov/bkmk/table/1.0/en/ACS/11_1YR/B03001-
/0100000US US Census Bureau 2011 American Community Survey B03001 1-Year
Estimates HISPANIC OR LATINO ORIGIN BY SPECIFIC ORIGIN] retrieved October 28,
2012

The United States is home to the second largest Mexican community in the world
second only to Mexico itself comprising nearly 22% of the entire Mexican origin
population of the world. Canada is a distant third with a small but fast-growing
Mexican Canadian population of 61,505 as of 2006 (compared to 37,000 as of 2001-
). [http://www12.statcan.ca/english/census01/products/highlight/ETO/Table1.-
cfm?Lang=E&T=501&GV=1&GID=0 Statistics Canada: 2001 Census: Ethnocultural
Portrait of Canada] [http://www12.statcan.ca/census-recensement/2006/dp-
pd/hlt/97-
562/pages/page.cfm?Lang=E&Geo=PR&Code=01&Table=2&Data=Count&StartRec=1&Sort=3&D-
isplay=All&CSDFilter=5000 Statistics Canada 2006: "Ethnic origins, 2006 counts,
for Canada, provinces and territories"]

In addition, as of 2008 there were approximately 7,000,000 undocumented Mexicans
living in the United States. Upgrading their legal status became a major issue
in 2013. [http://pewhispanic.org/files/reports/107.pdf Pew Hispanic Center:
"A Portrait of Unauthorized Immigrants to the United States"] April 11,
2009 Over 60% of all Mexican Americans reside in the states of California
and Texas.
categories: Ethnic groups in the United States
headings: The Chicano movement and the Chicano Moratorium
